Sentencas: We report a correlation between the microstructure of the anode electrode of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) and its electrochemical performance for a tubular design.
Titulo: Impact of Anode Microstructure on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It was shown that the electrochemical performance of the cell was extensively improved when the size of constituent particles was reduced so as to yield a highly porous microstructure.
Titulo: Impact of Anode Microstructure on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The SOFC had a power density of greater than 1 watt per square centimeter at an operating temperature as low as 600 degrees C with a conventional zirconia-based electrolyte, a nickel cermet anode, and a lanthanum ferrite perovskite cathode material.
Titulo: Impact of Anode Microstructure on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The effect of the hydrogen fuel flow rate (linear velocity) was also examined for the optimization of operating conditions.
Titulo: Impact of Anode Microstructure on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Higher linear fuel velocity led to better cell performance for the cell with higher anode porosity.
Titulo: Impact of Anode Microstructure on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A zirconia-based cell could be used for a low-temperature SOFC system under 600 degrees C just by optimizing the microstructure of the anode electrode and operating conditions.
Titulo: Impact of Anode Microstructure on Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
